revised_title: Attractors for Modified Three-Dimensional Navier-Stokes Equations
tldr: The authors study the modifications of the three-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations, which describe viscous fluid flows with large velocity gradients. They prove that the first initial-boundary value problem for these equations has a compact minimal global attractor, and establish some properties of the attractor. This work contributes to the understanding of fluid dynamics and the behavior of solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations.
